item.title: Black Ops 6 Players Explore New Warzone Map ‘Avalon’ in Spectator
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/warzone-avalon-map/

Black Ops 6 players have figured out that you can explore the upcoming Warzone map ‘Avalon’ by using Black Ops 6 spectator mode.

Video footage of people exploring the map have been ongoing since the games launch, which shows the entirety of the upcoming map and what exactly it’s going to entail.

To load the map yourself, simple load up the multiplayer map ‘Lowtown’ in a Black Ops 6 private match and enter spectator mode, from here, you’ll be able to explore the map in full detail in the ‘Codcaster’ role.

You can see a video of the full flythrough below:

But don’t get your hopes up just yet. Despite the map being already fully complete (and being so for a while now), it isn’t actually the next Warzone map to be released. Earlier this year, we reported that Verdansk is set to make its triumphant return first, which was a decision made around the same time as the highly popular original Fortnite map made its return and was tremendously successful.

It’s understood that Verdansk is set to make it’s return sometime at the beginning for 2025, with Avalon releasing sometime later in the year depending on Verdansk’s success.

What do you think of our latest look at the Warzone map Avalon? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out everything about the closure of Firewalk Studios at Sony. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

Firewalk Studios Releases Statement On Closure

Firewalk Studios has released an official statement after the announcement by Sony of the studio’s closure.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Season 1 Starts November 14 With “Massive Content Drop”

Activision has confirmed that Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Season 1 will begin in November, and include a number of new additions.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Gets Second Update

Activision has released the second post-launch update for Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 that addresses a number of Zombies exploits.

Path of Exile 2 Early Access Has Been Delayed 

According to the latest statement by Grinding Gear Games, Path of Exile 2’s early access has been delayed by 3 weeks.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Season 1 Starts November 14 With “Massive Content Drop”
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/call-of-duty-black-ops-6-season-1-starts-november-14-with-massive-content-drop/

Activision has confirmed that Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Season 1 will begin on November 14, and, with it, comes what it calls a “massive content drop”.

According to the publisher, the start of Black Ops 6 Season 1 will add a “colossal amount of free content like all-new Multiplayer maps and modes, a terrifying new in-season Zombies map, as well as the introduction of Omnimovement and Black Ops 6 weapons and Loadout features to Call of Duty: Warzone!”

The confirmation of the start of the first season comes after the date was recently leaked thanks to Little Caesars pizza promo.

As far as what Black Ops 6 Season 1 will include, full details will come shortly before it’s start date. When it comes, Activision says it will break down “all the new maps, modes, weapons, features, and more across Multiplayer, Zombies, and Call of Duty: Warzone.”

RELATED: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Gets Second Update

Aside from Season 1’s start date, Activision announced the return of the Infected game mode that is available for all players along with confirming, again, that Nuketown will launch on November 1.

“Built by Veteran Treyarch Map designer Adam Hoggatt and released as part of Call of Duty: Black Ops in November 2010, this remaster remains extremely faithful to the original design and layout of the map, even down to the precise placement of parked vehicles and other scenery harking back to the original three-lane design,” Activision said.

“This is Nuketown in its most original form, with a bright and bleached desert landscape, and even a double rainbow to gaze at, taking you all the way back to where it all began.”

What do you think Season 1 will include? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out everything about the closure of Firewalk Studios at Sony. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
